title: The F bomb
body: Why is it okay for RIOT EMPLOYEES to drop the F bomb over and over again uncensored, in and official video put out by the company. Yet you use that kind of language in the game itself and they are looking for reasons to ban you. This is a huge double standard, not to mention incredibly unprofessional.

replies.body: I've never had an issue with using the word "f\*ck", whether it's in-game or on the boards (and forums prior). As far as I understand it, it comes down to the context. For example, saying things like "Well, f\*ck" or "F\*ck me" when you make a mistake (as I often do) likely wouldn't warrant any kind of punishment, since you're not actually breaking any rules. Whereas things like "f\*ck you" or "this f\*cking noob [insert champion name here]" would likely result in some kind of action being taken by Riot, not so much because of the usage of the word "f\*ck" but more so because it's directed abuse.

Some Riot employees f#cked up, and they were just admitting "Yeah, we f#cked up" and there isn't more suitable words to use to describe as such. The video is abit odd to listen to, coming out of Riot directly, but it isn't like a 90's rap album.
